definition: to hire at a high salary
policy of high pay to discourage corruption

sentences.english: Financial tycoons are notorious for their exorbitant salaries.
sentences.chinese: 金融大款們就是牛在高薪。

sentences.english: Aquarians are good workers and usually are paid well.
sentences.chinese: 水瓶座的人是優秀的從業人員，通常享有高薪。

sentences.english: They are healthy, gainfully employed young people.
sentences.chinese: 他們是健康又高薪的年輕人。

sentences.english: Of course, the ideal position is to have money and satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 當然，理想的情況是高薪與滿足感兼得。

sentences.english: There are many highly-paid managers and entertainers who do not like themselves.
sentences.chinese: 許多被高薪聘請的經理和藝人們都不喜歡他們自己。

sentences.english: Many teachers have switched to business because of the temptation of the high returns.
sentences.chinese: 在高薪的利誘之下，許多教師都改行經商了。

sentences.english: And women hold 51% of good-paying management and professional jobs.
sentences.chinese: 而女性佔據了51%的高薪管理及專業職位。

sentences.english: Pattern-recognition technologies are making numerous highly paid skills redundant.
sentences.chinese: 圖像識別技術使得無數的高薪技術人員變得多餘了。

sentences.english: She balanced the attractions of a high salary against the prospect of working long hours .
sentences.chinese: 她對高薪和長工時兩者的利弊作了權衡比較。

sentences.english: High earners can also be mobile.
sentences.chinese: 高薪者也可以逐利而動。

sentences.english: Perhaps it's better to be a well-paid nanny than an attention-starved rich kid.
sentences.chinese: 也許做一個高薪保姆比做缺乏關心的有錢小孩要好。

sentences.english: Many jukus offer high salaries to recruit experienced teachers.
sentences.chinese: 許多課外補習學校高薪招聘有經驗的教師。

sentences.english: The high-salaried manager replaced the swaggering tycoon.
sentences.chinese: 高薪的經理代替了趾高氣揚的大老闆。

sentences.english: Will it side with demands for higher pay and let strikes broaden?
sentences.chinese: 它會支持更高薪給的要求，讓罷工擴大事態？

sentences.english: Never ask for a large salary or big-budget perks.
sentences.chinese: 絕對不能要求高薪或者高額補貼。

sentences.english: She blathered on for half an hour about her high-paying job.
sentences.chinese: 有關她那高薪工作她瞎侃了半個鐘頭。

definition: to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to hire at a high salary
higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree
to poach (talent, personnel from competitors)/to raid (a competitor for its talent)/Taiwan pr. [wa1 jiao3]
